standard_metadata.standard_description: Solve linear equations with rational number coefficients, including equations whose solutions require expanding expressions using the distributive property and collecting like terms.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Equations with variables on both sides: decimals & fractions

hints.content: We need to manipulate the equation to get $   s   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 0.5s+1&=7+4.5s \\\\ 0.5s+1 \blueD{-4.5s} &= 7+4.5s\blueD{-4.5s} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 4.5s from each side.}}\\\\ -4s+1&=7 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ -4s+1\blueD{-1} &= 7\blueD{-1} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 1 from each side.}}\\\\ -4s &=6 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{-4s}{\blueD{-4}} &= \dfrac{6}{\blueD{-4}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by -4}.}\\\\ s &= \greenD{-1.5} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$s = \greenD{    -1.5 }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $   a   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 4a+5&=2+3.25a \\\\ 4a+5 \blueD{-3.25a} &= 2+3.25a\blueD{-3.25a} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 3.25a from each side.}}\\\\ 0.75a+5&=2 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 0.75a+5\blueD{-5} &= 2\blueD{-5} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 5 from each side.}}\\\\ 0.75a &=-3 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{0.75a}{\blueD{0.75}} &= \dfrac{-3}{\blueD{0.75}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 0.75.}}\\\\ a &= \greenD{-4} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$a = \greenD{ -4    }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $   c   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 5c+16.5&=13.5+10c \\\\ 5c+16.5 \blueD{-10c} &= 13.5+10c\blueD{-10c} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 10c from each side.}}\\\\ -5c+16.5&=13.5 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ -5c+16.5\blueD{-16.5} &= 13.5\blueD{-16.5} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 16.5 from each side.}}\\\\ -5c &=-3 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{-5c}{\blueD{-5}} &= \dfrac{-3}{\blueD{-5}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by -5.}}\\\\ c &= \greenD{0.6} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$c = \greenD{ 0.6  }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $   d   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 2d+4&=10+2.5d \\\\ 2d+4 \blueD{-2.5d} &= 10+2.5d\blueD{-2.5d} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 2.5d from each side.}}\\\\ -0.5d+4&=10 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ -0.5d+4\blueD{-4} &= 10\blueD{-4} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 4 from each side.}}\\\\ -0.5d &=6 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{-0.5d}{\blueD{-0.5}} &= \dfrac{6}{\blueD{-0.5}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by -0.5.}}\\\\ d &= \greenD{-12} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$d = \greenD{ -12    }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $  x    $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 4x+8&=7.2+5x \\\\ 4x+8 \blueD{-5x} &= 7.2+5x\blueD{-5x} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 5x from each side.}}\\\\ -x+8&=7.2 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ -x+8\blueD{-8} &= 7.2\blueD{-8} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 8 from each side.}}\\\\ -x &=-0.8 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{-x}{\blueD{-1}} &= \dfrac{-0.8}{\blueD{-1}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by -1.}}\\\\ x &= \greenD{0.8} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$x = \greenD{  0.8   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $    f  $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 2+1.25f&=10-2.75f \\\\ 2+1.25f \blueD{+2.75f} &= 10-2.75f\blueD{+2.75f} &&\small\gray{\text{Add 2.75f to each side.}}\\\\ 4f+2&=10 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 4f+2\blueD{-2} &= 10\blueD{-2} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 2 from each side.}}\\\\ 4f &=8 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{4f}{\blueD{4}} &= \dfrac{8}{\blueD{4}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 4.}}\\\\ f &= \greenD{2} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$f = \greenD{  2   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $   g   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 9+3.5g&=11-0.5g \\\\ 9+3.5g \blueD{+0.5g} &= 11-0.5g\blueD{+0.5g} &&\small\gray{\text{Add 0.5g to each side.}}\\\\ 9+4g&=11 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 4g+9\blueD{-9} &= 11\blueD{-9} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 9 from each side.}}\\\\ 4g &=2 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{4g}{\blueD{4}} &= \dfrac{2}{\blueD{4}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 4.}}\\\\ g &= \greenD{0.5} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$g = \greenD{ 0.5    }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $   h   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 15.3+1h&=1.3-1h \\\\ 15.3+1h \blueD{+1h} &= 1.3-1h\blueD{+1h} &&\small\gray{\text{Add 1h to each side.}}\\\\ 2h+15.3&=1.3 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 2h+15.3\blueD{-15.3} &= 1.3\blueD{-15.3} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 15.3 from each side.}}\\\\ 2h &=-14 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{2h}{\blueD{2}} &= \dfrac{-14}{\blueD{2}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 2.}}\\\\ h &= \greenD{-7} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$h = \greenD{  -7   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $  k    $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 4.5+1.5k&=18-3k \\\\ 4.5+1.5k \blueD{+3k} &= 18-3k\blueD{+3k} &&\small\gray{\text{Add 3k to each side.}}\\\\ 4.5k+4.5&=18 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 4.5k+4.5\blueD{-4.5} &= 18\blueD{-4.5} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 4.5 from each side.}}\\\\ 4.5k &=13.5 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{4.5k}{\blueD{4.5}} &= \dfrac{13.5}{\blueD{4.5}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 4.5.}}\\\\ k &= \greenD{3} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$k = \greenD{  3   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $    m  $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 12.6+4m&=9.6+8m \\\\ 12.6+4m \blueD{-8m} &= 9.6+8m\blueD{-8m} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 8m from each side.}}\\\\ 12.6-4m&=9.6 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 12.6-4m\blueD{-12.6} &= 9.6\blueD{-12.6} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 12.6 from each side.}}\\\\ -4m &=-3 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{-4m}{\blueD{-4}} &= \dfrac{-3}{\blueD{-4}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by -4.}}\\\\ m &= \greenD{0.75} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$m = \greenD{0.75     }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $b$ by itself.

$\begin{align} \dfrac23b + 5 &= 20 - b \\\\ \dfrac23b + 5 \blueD{+b} &= 20 - b \blueD{+ b} &&\small\gray{\text{Add b to each side.}}\\\\ \dfrac53b+5 &= 20 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac53b+5 \blueD{-5} &= 20 \blueD{- 5} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 5 from each side.}}\\\\ \dfrac53b &= 15 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac53b\cdot \blueD{\dfrac35}&= 15 \cdot \blueD{\dfrac35}&&\small\gray{\text{Multiply each side by}\dfrac35.} \\\\ b &= \greenD{9} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$b = \greenD{9}~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $   n   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 2-\dfrac12n&=3n+16 \\\\ 2-\dfrac12n \blueD{-3n} &= 3n+16\blueD{-3n} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 3n from each side.}}\\\\ -\dfrac72n+2&=16 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ -\dfrac72n+2\blueD{-2} &= 16\blueD{-2} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 2 from each side.}}\\\\ -\dfrac72n &=14 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ -\dfrac72n\cdot\left(\blueD{-\dfrac27}\right) &= 14\cdot\left(\blueD{-\dfrac27}\right) &&\small\gray{\text{Multiply each side by }-\dfrac27.}\\\\ n&=-\dfrac{28}7\\\\ n &= \greenD{-4} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$ n= \greenD{   -4   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $   p   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 16-3p&=\dfrac23p+5 \\\\ 16-3p \blueD{-\dfrac23p} &= \dfrac23p+5\blueD{-\dfrac23p} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract }\dfrac23p \text{ from each side.}}\\\\ -\dfrac{11}{3}p+16&=5 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ -\dfrac{11}{3}p+16\blueD{-16} &= 5\blueD{-16} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 16 from each side.}}\\\\ -\dfrac{11}{3}p &=-11 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ -\dfrac{11}{3}p\cdot\left(\blueD{-\dfrac{3}{11}}\right) &= -11\cdot\left(\blueD{-\dfrac{3}{11}}\right) &&\small\gray{\text{Multiply each side by -}\dfrac{3}{11}.}\\\\ p&=\dfrac{33}{11}\\\\\\ p &= \greenD{3} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$ p= \greenD{   3   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $ r     $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 12-\dfrac15r&=2r+1 \\\\ 12-\dfrac15r \blueD{-2r} &= 2r+1\blueD{-2r} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 2r from each side.}}\\\\ -\dfrac{11}5r+12&=1 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ -\dfrac{11}5r+12\blueD{-12} &= 1\blueD{-12} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 12 from each side.}}\\\\ -\dfrac{11}5r &=-11 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ -\dfrac{11}{5}r\cdot\left(\blueD{-\dfrac{5}{11}}\right) &= -11\cdot\left(\blueD{-\dfrac{5}{11}}\right) &&\small\gray{\text{Multiply each side by -}\dfrac{5}{11}.}\\\\ r&=\dfrac{55}{11}\\\\\\ r &= \greenD{5} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$r = \greenD{5      }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $   s   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 2-2s&=\dfrac34s+13 \\\\ 2-2s \blueD{-\dfrac34s} &= \dfrac34s+13\blueD{-\dfrac34s} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract }\dfrac34s \text{ from each side.}}\\\\ -\dfrac{11}4 s+2&=13 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ -\dfrac{11}4s+2\blueD{-2} &= 13\blueD{-2} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 2 from each side.}}\\\\ -\dfrac{11}4s &=11 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ -\dfrac{11}{4}s\cdot\left(\blueD{-\dfrac{4}{11}}\right) &= 11\cdot\left(\blueD{-\dfrac{4}{11}}\right) &&\small\gray{\text{Multiply each side by -}\dfrac{4}{11}.}\\\\ s&=-\dfrac{44}{11}\\\\\ s &= \greenD{-4} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$s = \greenD{     -4 }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $   t   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 16-2t&=\dfrac32t+9 \\\\ 16-2t \blueD{-\dfrac32t} &= \dfrac32t+9\blueD{-\dfrac32t} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract }\dfrac32 t \text{ from each side.}}\\\\ -\dfrac72t+16&=9 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ -\dfrac72t+16\blueD{-16} &= 9\blueD{-16} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 16 from each side.}}\\\\ -\dfrac72t &=-7 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ -\dfrac{7}{2}t\cdot\left(\blueD{-\dfrac{2}{7}}\right) &= -7\cdot\left(\blueD{-\dfrac{2}{7}}\right) &&\small\gray{\text{Multiply each side by -}\dfrac{2}{7}.}\\\\ t&=\dfrac{14}{7}\\\\\ t &= \greenD{2} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$ t= \greenD{  2    }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $   a   $ by itself.

$\begin{align} -\dfrac14a-4&=\dfrac74a-3 \\\\ -\dfrac14a-4 \blueD{-\dfrac74a} &= \dfrac74a-3\blueD{-\dfrac74a} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract} \dfrac74a \text{ from each side.}}\\\\ -2a-4&=-3 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ -2a-4\blueD{+4} &= -3\blueD{+4} &&\small\gray{\text{Add 4 to each side.}}\\\\ -2a &=1 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{-2a}{\blueD{-2}} &= \dfrac{1}{\blueD{-2}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by -2.}}\\\\ a &= \greenD{-\dfrac12} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$ a= \greenD{-\dfrac12      }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $  b    $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 7b-\dfrac25&=6b-\dfrac75 \\\\ 7b-\dfrac25 \blueD{-6b} &= 6b-\dfrac75\blueD{-6b} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 6b from each side.}}\\\\ 1b-\dfrac25&=-\dfrac75 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 1b-\dfrac25\blueD{+\dfrac25} &= -\dfrac75\blueD{+\dfrac25} &&\small\gray{\text{Add }\dfrac25\text{ to each side.}}\\\\ 1b &=-1 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{1b}{\blueD{1}} &= \dfrac{-1}{\blueD{1}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 1}}\\\\ b &= \greenD{-1} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$b = \greenD{ -1     }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $  c    $ by itself.

$\begin{align} \dfrac83c-2&=\dfrac23c-12 \\\\ \dfrac83c-2 \blueD{-\dfrac23c} &= \dfrac23c-12\blueD{-\dfrac23c} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract } \dfrac23c \text{ from each side.}}\\\\ 2c-2&=-12 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 2c-2\blueD{+2} &= -12\blueD{+2} &&\small\gray{\text{Add 2 to each side.}}\\\\ 2c &=-10 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{2c}{\blueD{2}} &= \dfrac{-10}{\blueD{2}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 2.}}\\\\ c &= \greenD{-5} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$c = \greenD{  -5    }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $  d    $ by itself.

$\begin{align} 6d-\dfrac{11}2&=2d-\dfrac{13}2 \\\\ 6d-\dfrac{11}2 \blueD{-2d} &= 2d-\dfrac{13}2\blueD{-2d} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract 2d from each side.}}\\\\ 4d-\dfrac{11}2&=-\dfrac{13}2 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 4d-\dfrac{11}2\blueD{+\dfrac{11}2} &= -\dfrac{13}2\blueD{+\dfrac{11}2} &&\small\gray{\text{Add }\dfrac{11}2\text{ to each side.}}\\\\ 4d &=-1 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{4d}{\blueD{4}} &= \dfrac{-1}{\blueD{4}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 4.}}\\\\ d &= \greenD{-\dfrac14} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$ d= \greenD{   -\dfrac14   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
We need to manipulate the equation to get $  y    $ by itself.

$\begin{align} \dfrac94y-12&=\dfrac14y-4 \\\\ \dfrac94y-12 \blueD{-\dfrac14y} &= \dfrac14y-4\blueD{-\dfrac14y} &&\small\gray{\text{Subtract } \dfrac14y \text{ from each side.}}\\\\ 2y-12&=-4 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ 2y-12\blueD{+12} &= -4\blueD{+12} &&\small\gray{\text{Add 12 to each side.}}\\\\ 2y &=8 &&\small\gray{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\\\ \dfrac{2y}{\blueD{2}} &= \dfrac{8}{\blueD{2}} &&\small\gray{\text{Divide each side by 2.}}\\\\ y &= \greenD{4} &&\small\gray{\text{Simplify.}}\\\\ \end{align}$
**The answer:**  >$y = \greenD{   4   }~~~~~~~~$ [[☃ explanation 1]]
